rev.comment: Shouldn't this go to the paypal page? Of course it is expected that they have rules against the competition
rev.diff:
Line 177: Line 177:
==Adoption==
==Adoption==
â
[[Wikileaks]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://wikileaks.org/support.html |title=Donate |publisher=Wikileaks.org |date= |accessdate=2011-06-22}}</ref><ref>http://twitter.com/#!/wikileaks/status/80774521350668288</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Greenberg |first=Andy |url=http://blogs.forbes.com/andygreenberg/2011/06/14/wikileaks-asks-for-anonymous-bitcoin-donations/ |title=WikiLeaks Asks For Anonymous Bitcoin Donations - Andy Greenberg - The Firewall - Forbes |publisher=Blogs.forbes.com |date=2011-06-14 |accessdate=2011-06-22}}</ref> the [[Free Software Foundation]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fsf.org/blogs/community/bitcoins-a-new-way-to-donate-to-the-fsf |title=Bitcoins: A new way to donate to the FSF â Free Software Foundation â working together for free software |publisher=Fsf.org |date= |accessdate=2011-06-22}}</ref> [[Freenet]],<ref>{{cite web|url=https://freenetproject.org/donate.html |title=/donate |publisher=The Freenet Project |date= |accessdate=2011-06-22}}</ref> [[Pioneer One]],<ref>http://twitter.com/#!/pioneeronetv/status/36119594439544832</ref> and several others<ref>{{cite web|url=https://en.bitcoin.it/wiki/Donation-accepting_organizations_and_projects |title=Donation-accepting organizations and projects - Bitcoin |publisher=En.bitcoin.it |date= |accessdate=2011-06-22}}</ref> already accept donations in Bitcoin. The [[Electronic Frontier Foundation]] did for a while but it is no longer doing it because of lack of legal precedent about new currency systems, and also to avoid the perception that they in any way endorse or support the Bitcoin project.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.eff.org/deeplinks/2011/06/eff-and-bitcoin |title=EFF and Bitcoin | Electronic Frontier Foundation |publisher=Eff.org |date=2011-06-14 |accessdate=2011-06-22}}</ref> Gavin Andresen, one of the 'core developers', is explicitly advising people "not to make heavy investments in Bitcoins", as it is "kind of like a high risk investment".<ref>{{cite episode | title=/59/Bitcoin â a Digital, Decentralized Currency (at 31 min.)| series=omega tau podcast | url=http://omegataupodcast.net/2011/03/59-bitcoin-a-digital-decentralized-currency/ | airdate=19 March 2011}}</ref> As of May 2011, no major{{Vague|date=June 2011}} retailer accepts the currency for payment.<ref name="wbi"/> PayPal has an active policy against virtual currencies.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.paypal.com/us/cgi-bin/?cmd=p/sell/mc/mc_intro-outside |title=Multiple Currencies |publisher=PayPal |date=2011-06-18 |accessdate=2011-06-22}}</ref>
+
[[Wikileaks]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://wikileaks.org/support.html |title=Donate |publisher=Wikileaks.org |date= |accessdate=2011-06-22}}</ref><ref>http://twitter.com/#!/wikileaks/status/80774521350668288</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Greenberg |first=Andy |url=http://blogs.forbes.com/andygreenberg/2011/06/14/wikileaks-asks-for-anonymous-bitcoin-donations/ |title=WikiLeaks Asks For Anonymous Bitcoin Donations - Andy Greenberg - The Firewall - Forbes |publisher=Blogs.forbes.com |date=2011-06-14 |accessdate=2011-06-22}}</ref> the [[Free Software Foundation]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fsf.org/blogs/community/bitcoins-a-new-way-to-donate-to-the-fsf |title=Bitcoins: A new way to donate to the FSF â Free Software Foundation â working together for free software |publisher=Fsf.org |date= |accessdate=2011-06-22}}</ref> [[Freenet]],<ref>{{cite web|url=https://freenetproject.org/donate.html |title=/donate |publisher=The Freenet Project |date= |accessdate=2011-06-22}}</ref> [[Pioneer One]],<ref>http://twitter.com/#!/pioneeronetv/status/36119594439544832</ref> and several others<ref>{{cite web|url=https://en.bitcoin.it/wiki/Donation-accepting_organizations_and_projects |title=Donation-accepting organizations and projects - Bitcoin |publisher=En.bitcoin.it |date= |accessdate=2011-06-22}}</ref> already accept donations in Bitcoin. The [[Electronic Frontier Foundation]] did for a while but it is no longer doing it because of lack of legal precedent about new currency systems, and also to avoid the perception that they in any way endorse or support the Bitcoin project.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.eff.org/deeplinks/2011/06/eff-and-bitcoin |title=EFF and Bitcoin | Electronic Frontier Foundation |publisher=Eff.org |date=2011-06-14 |accessdate=2011-06-22}}</ref> Gavin Andresen, one of the 'core developers', is explicitly advising people "not to make heavy investments in Bitcoins", as it is "kind of like a high risk investment".<ref>{{cite episode | title=/59/Bitcoin â a Digital, Decentralized Currency (at 31 min.)| series=omega tau podcast | url=http://omegataupodcast.net/2011/03/59-bitcoin-a-digital-decentralized-currency/ | airdate=19 March 2011}}</ref> As of May 2011, no major{{Vague|date=June 2011}} retailer accepts the currency for payment.<ref name="wbi"/>
